deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title  PolicyFlow
 @notice This is the policy flow contract which is responsible for the whole lifecycle of a policy.
         Every policy's information are stored in this contract.
         A policy will have a unique "_policyId":
          The total order in this product. Should be equal to its ERC721 tokenId
         The main functions of a policy are: newApplication & newClaimRequest.
         We use Chainlink in this contract to get the final status of a flight.
@notice Constructor Function

documentation.text:
@title  PolicyFlow
 @notice This is the policy flow contract which is responsible for the whole lifecycle of a policy.
         Every policy's information are stored in this contract.
         A policy will have a unique "_policyId":
          The total order in this product. Should be equal to its ERC721 tokenId
         The main functions of a policy are: newApplication & newClaimRequest.
         We use Chainlink in this contract to get the final status of a flight.
@notice Constructor Function

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "only the owner can call this function"

arguments.value: only the owner can call this function

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "only the owner can call this function"

getChainlinkToken().details: This is the public implementation for chainlinkTokenAddress, which is      an internal method of the ChainlinkClient contract

params._policyId: Total count/order of the policy = NFT tokenId

returns.policy: A struct of information about this policy

newApplication(uint256,string,uint256,ui.details: Get the signature from the backend server

params._departureDate: Departure date of this flight (unix timestamp in s, not ms!)
params._landingDate: Landing date of this flight (uinx timestamp in s, not ms!)
params._productId: ID of the purchased product (0: flightdelay; 1,2,3...: others) (different products)
params.signature: Use web3.eth.sign(hash(data), account) to generate the signature

params._path: Which data in json needs to get
params._policyId: The total order/id of the policy

policyOwnerTransfer(uint256,address,addr.details: This function is called by the ERC721 contract of PolicyToken

params._tokenId: Token Id of the policy token

changeMinTimeBeforeDeparture(uint256).notice: How long before departure when users can not buy new policies

finalSettlement(bytes32,uint256).notice: Do the final settlement, called by FlightOracle contract

findPolicyBuyerById(uint256).notice: Get the policy buyer by policyId

getChainlinkToken().notice: Returns the address of the LINK token

getPolicyInfoById(uint256).notice: Get the policyInfo from its count/order

getUserPolicyCount(address).notice: Get a user's total policy amount

policyOwnerTransfer(uint256,address,addr.notice: Update information when a policy token's ownership has been transferred

setDelayThreshold(uint256,uint256).notice: Set the new delay threshold used for calculating payoff

userdoc.notice: This is the policy flow contract which is responsible for the whole lifecycle of a policy.         Every policy's information are stored in this contract.         A policy will have a unique "_policyId":          The total order in this product. Should be equal to its ERC721 tokenId         The main functions of a policy are: newApplication & newClaimRequest.         We use Chainlink in this contract to get the final status of a flight.
